item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Lessons I learned working at an art gallery (44 points | 11 comments)
2. 8 months of OCaml after 8 years of Haskell in production (2023) (96 points | 51 comments)
3. Show HN: Copper – Open-source robotics in Rust with deterministic log replay (72 points | 16 comments)
4. Fish have a brain microbiome – could humans have one too? (213 points | 83 comments)
5. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (December 2024) (257 points | 218 comments)
6. World Labs: Generate 3D worlds from a single image (328 points | 111 comments)
7. Accelerated AI Inference via Dynamic Execution Methods (40 points | 1 comment)
8. Show HN: Open-sourced (road) traffic counting application (52 points | 10 comments)
9. Bioluminescent wood using the white rot fungus desarmillaria tabescens (87 points | 17 comments)
10. Optimality of Gerver's Sofa (86 points | 16 comments)
11. Evidence of the use of silk by Bronze Age civilization (121 points | 44 comments)
12. .NET Support on Heroku (50 points | 31 comments)
13. A better approach to gravity: how we made EGM2008 faster (43 points | 15 comments)
14. Every board game rulebook is awful [pdf] (214 points | 199 comments)
15. A Collection of Kaleidoscope Schemes, Sourced from the WayBack Machine. (20 points | 5 comments)
16. Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (December 2024) (101 points | 210 comments)
17. Show HN: Flow – A dynamic task engine for building AI agents (76 points | 28 comments)
18. FizzBuzz in Powerchords (6 points | discuss)
19. Intel announces retirement of Pat Gelsinger (782 points | 627 comments)
20. Ethiopian wolves reported to feed on nectar (35 points | 12 comments)
21. Unlocking the power of time-series data with multimodal models (97 points | 22 comments)
22. Kenya and "the decline of the greatest coffee" (2021) (175 points | 144 comments)
23. Show HN: SeekStorm – open-source sub-millisecond search in Rust (151 points | 35 comments)
24. Teaching quantum physics in schools: Experts encourage focus on 2 state systems (8 points | 2 comments)
25. Murderbot, she wrote (186 points | 134 comments)
26. The world of Dante's Divine Comedy (59 points | 35 comments)
27. Show HN: Book and change flights with one email (18 points | 5 comments)
28. KlongPy: High-Performance Array Programming in Python (112 points | 61 comments)
29. Facebook's Little Red Book (388 points | 188 comments)
30. The Sperry Rand Corporation (58 points | 26 comments)
